DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the affect of multiple health education interventions for statins medication compliance and clinical prognosis of ischemic stroke patients at 3, 6 and 12 months.
DOC.brief_title: Health Education Interventions for Statins Medication Compliance and Clinical Prognosis of Ischemic Stroke Patients
DOC.criteria: 1. Adult subjects (male or female ≥18 years); 2. Acute ischemic stroke occured within 14 days of symptoms onset 3. Blood low density lipoprotein (LDL) ≧100mg/dl（2.59mmol/L） 4. Patients were prescribed statins at discharge 5. Patients signed informed consent 6. Patients have a cell phone and have the ability to receive and view messages 1. Noncerebrovascular events or hemorrhagic stroke 2. Patients have serious heart, liver, kidney dysfunction or coagulation disorders 3. Patients have circumstances that may affect the followup such as disturbance of consciousness, severe depression or other mental disorders, aphasia 4. Modified Rankin Scale score at discharge ≥3 5. Patients with severe vision or vision field impairment which may affect patients to read message in cell phone 6. Those who are participating in other clinical trials 7. Those who can not guarantee with the completion of 6 month followup after enrollment
